quest.name: Short on Courage
journal:
 Quest Sync
The lovelorn townsdwarf is gazing wistfully into the distance.

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text:
<sigh>
Have you ever felt love's piercing sting?

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: There's this Hume girl─no, this Hume lady─who's stabbed me right through the heart. I saw her on my way back from the mines, and I've been dreaming of her ever since...

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: They say love is a dance, aye? Well, I've been watching from the edges for long enough─I think it's time I took to the floor!

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text:
She should be on her way to fetch water from the river soon, but...
Gah, I'm too nervous to approach her alone. Would you come with me? Please, you've got to come with me!

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: Thank you─you're the best friend I never had! Off to Boiled Owl Bridge we go!

dialogue.name: LADY03552
dialogue.text: ...Oh! I almost lost my bucket!

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text:
Look, there she is!
This is it, then. I'm just going to...stay right here because I'm a big, bearded coward.

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: ...I need another favor from you. Will you ask her if she's wed? And if unwed, then what manner of man makes her swoon? Oh, and make sure to be subtle!

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: I'm like to stumble over my own tongue if I try talking to her now. No, first I need you to ask if she's wed, or, if unwed, her preference in men. Perfectly innocent questions from a perfect stranger!

dialogue.name: LADY03552
dialogue.text: Oh, weren't you the ladyman who was traveling with Alphinaud? He spoke very highly of you, you know. Said he admired both your strength of arm and strength of character.

dialogue.name: LADY03552
dialogue.text: Now, what could such an admirable womanfellow want with a simple girl like me?

dialogue.name: LADY03552
dialogue.text: ...Am I wed? Well, no...and I've no prospects to speak of, neither. Amity is not exactly bursting at the seams with suitors.

dialogue.name: LADY03552
dialogue.text: ...And if I were to pick a suitor? Gracious me, you are forward, aren't you?

dialogue.name: LADY03552
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Well, it's what's on the inside that counts, isn't it? I would hope to meet a soul filled with warmth and kindness─someone much like how Alphinaud described you, I suppose.

dialogue.name: LADY03552
dialogue.text: No, I've no interest in how a person looks. I'd seek a partner with your qualities─someone kind and generous.

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: W-Well!? What did she say!?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What did she say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: She looks for kindness.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Appearances aren't important.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: She seemed to like me.

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: ...Kindness? What, like the sort of kindness you showed me...?

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: Hm? Is that something other folk judge their partners by?

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: In my village, it ain't considered polite to show your face until after you're wed. Helms stay on outside the family home! Still, it probably helps that she's not concerned with how I look...

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: ...Sh-She did!? And here I thought I'd brought an ally, not a rival!

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: <cough> Well, we should be heading back, then. It ain't right for me to demand help then leave you unpaid for your counsel!

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text: I was wrestling with the idea on the way home, and I've come to a conclusion: to win my lady's heart, I need to be more like you!

dialogue.name: DWARF03552
dialogue.text:
I'll travel the world, and make of myself a man worth marrying. Aye, I think I need to have a word with the chief...
Thanks again for coming along, friend!
